item.title: Trees need pruning, 28th September
item.description:
2 trees in Palace View on pavement need cutting back as branches are growing on lower trunk and taking over pavement and road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palace View, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of illegally placed flags along A220 between Carlton road and brook street, 27th September
item.description:
Seen on 27 Sep. Today we saw over 20 flags lining the A220. All illegally placed about half way up the lamp posts on both sides of the A220 between Carlton road and brook street. These are very distracting for motorist. These illegally placed flags are very upsetting and are a blatant show of disregard for the local communities. Other councils have openly condemned these flags and actively started taking them down. Why oh why is the Bexley council not standing up for their communities and removing them as they rightly should. As a white British I find these flags very upsetting. Every time we go out of the house there are more and more. Learn from history and don’t let it be repeated
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brook Street, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Broken mounting for water meter cover, 27th September
item.description:
This is extremely dangerous. Over the last month I have twisted my ankle when accidentally stepping on the cover and the cover has given way, allowing my foot to slip in . You can clearly see half of the outside housing of the cover is no longer in place.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Park Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Thurlow Park Road SE21 a few yards from Avenue P, 27th September
item.description:
Thurlow Park Road SE21 a few yards from Avenue Park Road junction on the none house number 12 side ie the wooden hoarding side is a green plastic Lambeth road sweeper’s bag bin which is graffiti tagged – picture attached – please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor. I recognise Thurlow Park Road comes under Transport for London (TfL) but under the Environmental Protection Act (EPA) Lambeth is still responsible for general street litter / rubbish = Lambeth bin = Lambeth property = Lambeth graffiti to clean. (NB You do not remove graffiti from hoardings – this report is re Lambeth’s street sweeper’s bin being graffiti tagged.) Google Streetview of bin: https://www.google.com/maps/@51.440534,-0.1036551,3a,50.1y,196.43h,90.13t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sy-UJHwFHgfOSVAI2rwfxHQ!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D-0.13154394631106925%26panoid%3Dy-UJHwFHgfOSVAI2rwfxHQ%26yaw%3D196.4317846265582!7i16384!8i8192?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDkyNC4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thurlow Park Road, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: People urinating on fence, 27th September
